H0.text: Natural fibers are the kind of fiber for which silk and cotton are examples.

H1.text: Pure is the kind of fiber that silk and cotton are examples of.

H2.text: Artificial fiber is the kind of fiber that includes silk and cotton.

H3.text: Simple is the type of fiber that includes silk and cotton.

A4.text: Cotton fibers made from the cotton plant, for example, produce fabrics that are light in weight, soft in texture, and which can be made in various sizes and colors.

A5.text: Silk fiber: Fiber secreted by glands (often located near the mouth) of insects during the preparation of cocoons.
